etymology.description: The glyph resembles an inverted 之(之) (zhī, "footprint") -> connection to 𠂤 (mound, hill) in 師(師)
etymology.interpretation: The character 帀(zā, "to surround") combines the concept of surrounding with the visual element of a footprint, suggesting an encircling motion. Its connection to the ancient glyph components related to hills and troops highlights its association with strategic positioning.
